ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Skeleton Loading States for Gallery Grid
ui_ux_improvements.description: Replace spinner loading indicators with skeleton placeholder cards that match the gallery grid layout for better perceived performance
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The Skeleton component exists (src/components/ui/skeleton.tsx) but the UnifiedImageGallery uses a centered spinner during loading. Skeleton screens reduce perceived wait time and prevent layout shift when content loads.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Gallery loading state (lines 607-611 in UnifiedImageGallery.tsx) shows a centered purple spinner with 'Loading gallery...' text. Community grid shows Loader2 spinner. This creates a jarring transition when images load and causes layout shift.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: 1. Create a SkeletonImageCard component that matches ImageCard dimensions with animated pulse placeholders. 2. During loading, render a grid of 8-12 SkeletonImageCards matching the current gridSize setting. 3. Use aspect-square or aspect-video based on useNativeAspectRatio setting. 4. Include skeleton badges for model and reference placeholders.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users see an immediate visual representation of incoming content, reducing perceived wait time by up to 40%. Eliminates layout shifts when images load, creating a smoother experience.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Focus Visible Indicators to Gallery Image Cards
ui_ux_improvements.description: Add clear keyboard focus indicators to ImageCard components for WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: ImageCard lacks visible focus states, making keyboard navigation impossible. This is a WCAG 2.1 requirement (2.4.7 Focus Visible) and important for users with motor impairments.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: ImageCard uses a div container with onClick handler but no tabIndex or focus styling (lines 82-100). Keyboard users cannot tab through gallery images or see focus state. The fullscreen modal supports arrow keys but individual cards lack focus support.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: 1. Add tabIndex={0} to ImageCard container. 2. Add focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-amber-500 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:outline-none classes. 3. Add onKeyDown handler to trigger onZoom on Enter/Space. 4. Add role='button' and aria-label describing the image. 5. Manage focus when modal opens/closes.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Keyboard-only users can navigate gallery efficiently. Users with motor impairments can access all gallery features. Meets WCAG 2.1 AA compliance for focus visible requirement.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Create Reusable EmptyState Component
ui_ux_improvements.description: Create a standardized EmptyState component and replace inconsistent empty state implementations across feature modules
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Empty states vary significantly - CommunityGrid uses Inbox icon, UnifiedImageGallery uses ImageIcon, with different text styling and layouts. Consistency improves user recognition and reduces cognitive load.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: UnifiedImageGallery (lines 612-619) shows ImageIcon at 48px with 'No images generated yet'. CommunityGrid (lines 43-50) shows Inbox at 48px with 'No items found'. Different padding (py-12 vs py-20), different opacity treatment, inconsistent action hints.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: Create src/components/ui/empty-state.tsx: interface EmptyStateProps { icon: LucideIcon; title: string; description?: string; action?: { label: string; onClick: () => void }; }. Standardize: py-16, icon at 48px with opacity-50, font-medium title, text-sm muted description, optional amber primary action button.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Consistent empty states help users immediately recognize they need to take action. Clear CTAs reduce confusion about what to do next. The app feels more cohesive and professionally designed.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Visual Drop Zone Feedback for File Uploads
ui_ux_improvements.description: Implement prominent visual feedback when users drag files over upload areas, with clear valid/invalid file type indicators
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Modern creative tools provide clear drag-and-drop feedback. Without visible drop zones, users may not discover drag-and-drop is supported or may be unsure where to drop files.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: AudioUploader has a drag-drop zone with dashed border but minimal dragOver visual change. Reference image upload areas may lack clear drag feedback. No distinction between valid and invalid file types during drag.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: 1. Create useDropZone hook managing dragOver/dragLeave/drop with visual state. 2. On drag enter: add pulsing border-2 border-amber-500, bg-amber-500/10 overlay, 'Drop to upload' text with Upload icon. 3. For invalid file types: red border with 'Invalid file type' message. 4. Add subtle scale transform (scale-[1.02]) on valid drag.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users immediately understand drag-and-drop is supported and know exactly where to drop. Clear invalid file feedback prevents confusion. The interaction feels responsive and matches expectations from other creative tools.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Confirmation Dialog for Destructive Actions
ui_ux_improvements.description: Implement a consistent confirmation dialog pattern for destructive actions like delete, with clear undo messaging where applicable
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Gallery image deletion and folder deletion lack consistent confirmation UX. Users may accidentally delete content without warning, especially on mobile where tap targets are close together.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Image deletion may happen directly from action menu without confirmation. FolderManagerModal has delete mode but the AlertDialog usage varies. No consistent pattern for destructive action confirmation across the app.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change: 1. Create a useConfirmDialog hook that returns { confirm, ConfirmDialog } with standardized AlertDialog. 2. For deletions: red destructive button, clear item description, 'This cannot be undone' warning. 3. For bulk deletions: show count of affected items. 4. Where possible, mention 'soft delete' period if applicable.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users are protected from accidental deletions. Clear warnings set expectations about permanence. Consistent confirmation pattern reduces anxiety about destructive actions and builds trust.

metadata.note: Browser automation (Puppeteer) was not available; analysis based on component code review. Ideas avoid duplicating planned features from ideation_context.json.
